optcom.equations.boundary_conditions.boundary_conditions_ampnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.boundary_conditions.boundary_conditions_ampnlse.BoundaryConditionsAmpNLSE(AmpNLSE, REFL_SEED=True, REFL_PUMP=True, PRE_PUMP_PROP=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.boundary_conditions.abstract_boundary_conditions.AbstractBoundaryConditions

Boundary conditions for AmpNLSE equations.

Parameters

  • AmpNLSE -- The equation to which the boundary conditions are linked.

  • REFL_SEED (bool) -- If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

  • REFL_PUMP (bool) -- If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

  • PRE_PUMP_PROP -- If True, propagate only the pump the first iteration and then add the seed at the second iteration. Otherwise, consider both pump and seed simultaneously. Results will be consistent but setting this flag to True can have a significant impact on the convergence speed. Without knowledge of the algorithm, it is adviced to let it to False.

apply_cond(*args, **kwargs)¶
get_input(waves, noises, upper_bound)¶

Save the initial waves and noises and return the first guess. The first guess is the pump waves and noises only, the seeds are considered later by the boundary conditions.

Parameters

  • waves -- The initial values of the wave envelopes.

  • noises -- The initial values of the noise powers.

  • upper_bound -- If True, considered first guess at the end z=L. Otherwise, considered at the end z=0.

Returns

The first guesses of wave envelopes and noise powers.

get_output(waves_f, waves_b, noises_f, noises_b)¶

Return the ouput of the waves and noises depending on the initial waves and noises saved in get_input().

Parameters

  • waves_f -- The final values of the wave envelopes at z=0.

  • waves_b -- The final values of the wave envelopes at z=L.

  • noises_f -- The final values of the noise powers at z=0.

  • noises_b -- The final values of the noise powers at z=L.

Returns

The output of wave envelopes and noise powers.
